Origin: [Игрок] and company find a notice advertising a free-to-play card game. The moment they learn of the 100,000 rupie grand prize, they quickly make way for the bar to partake in the game.
[Игрок] and the crew are among the crowd, enjoying all the fun of the festival.
Russian: Игрок и экипаж находятся среди толпы, наслаждаясь всем весельем фестиваля.

Origin: They happen upon Sierokarte's Knickknack Shack, where business seems to be booming.

Name: Sierokarte
Origin: Welcome, everyone who's come to enjoy this wonderful event! Yes, it's the Festival of Falling Flame at last!

Name: Sierokarte
Origin: Just for this special day of the year, we have some exclusive wares on offer here at the Knickknack Shack!

Name: Vyrn
Origin: Hey, Siero! How's it going?

Name: Sierokarte
Origin: Hmm? Oh! If it isn't [Игрок] and the crew! Are you enjoying the festival?

Name: Katalina
Origin: Yes, but with so much going on, it's hard to decide what we want to see and do.

Name: Sierokarte
Origin: I know what you mean. There are so many different things from all corners of the skies here. It's really amazing!

Name: Sierokarte
Origin: I mean, just look at all the curios and delicacies... and then there's those exotic monsters from the circus of horrors!

Name: Sierokarte
Origin: Not to mention the main attraction this year—the duels being held on the Casino Liner!

Name: Vyrn
Origin: There weren't any festivals this massive back on Zinkenstill, were there, [Игрок]? Whoo, I'm so psyched!

Name: Vyrn
Origin: Huh?

Name: Vyrn
Origin: Hey, look over there!
Vyrn points at a notice on the bulletin board advertising a free-to-play card game.

Name: Vyrn
Origin: Whoa! 100,000 rupies for the winner?

Name: Vyrn
Origin: We should give it a shot!

Name: Katalina
Origin: Free? Impossible. There must be some sort of catch—

Name: Lyria
Origin: That's amazing! If we win, we can buy all kinds of new weapons, Katalina!

Name: Vyrn
Origin: All right, let's give it a go. Come on, [Игрок]!
And so the crew make their way toward the tavern in high spirits.
